scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Aravanaippu Illam. It is also known as AILLAM. The scheme “Aravanaippu Illam" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to take care of persons who are lacking basic needs & proper care in society, and to maintain them in a safe living condition. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as All. It is specifically implemented in Puducherry. Additionally, the nodal department is Social Welfare Department, Puducherry.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Free Shelter and Food.
Free Supply of 4 Sets of Dresses and Other Daily Living Needs. 
Free Medical Treatment (Referred to Nearby PHC). 
Training in Korai & Coir Mat Weaving. 
Labour Charges of ₹ 20/Per Mat for the Work of Mat Weaving as and When Carried Out. 
₹ 5/Per Day as Daily Pocket Money.
Recreation Like Radio, TV, Library, Besides Local Trips to Places of Interest and Temples. 
Annual Tour to Places of Interest. 
Annual Day, Conducted Every Year in Order to Exhibit Their Talents and for Prize Distribution.

NOTE: Contact the authorities below in case of delay in disbursal of benefits:
Puducherry: The Director, Directorate of Social Welfare, Saradhambal Nagar, Ellaipillaichavadhy, Puducherry. 
Karaikal: The Collector, Karaikal.
Mahe/Yanam: The Regional Administrator, Mahe/Yanam.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be lacking basic needs and proper care in society.
The applicant should be 20 years or above in age.
The applicant should not be suffering from communicable disease. The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Office/ SubOffice of the Department of Social Welfare, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filledin applications.
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the authority given below Puducherry: The Deputy Director, Differently Abled Section, Directorate of Social Welfare. Karaikal: The Assistant Director, Social Welfare Department (Sub Office).Mahe / Yanam: The Welfare Officer (i\c), Social Welfare Department (Sub Office). 
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/aravanaippu-illam-puducherry Citizen's Charter: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sites/default/files/citizen-charter.pdf Contact Us: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/contact-us Sub Offices: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sub--office-social-welfare-department Grievance Redressal: https://pgportal.gov.in/ Tags associated with the scheme include: Clothes, Disability, Food, Medical, Shelter.

", "answer": "Benefits include free shelter, food, medical treatment, dresses, daily living needs, and training in mat weaving."}, {"question": "What is the labor charge for mat weaving under the scheme?", "answer": "Labour charges for mat weaving amount to ₹20/- per mat, providing beneficiaries with an opportunity for skill-based income."}, {"question": "What recreational activities are provided to the beneficiaries?", "answer": "Recreational activities include access to radio, TV, library, local trips, an annual tour, and an annual day for talent exhibition.
"}, {"question": "How can one address delays in benefit disbursal?", "answer": "In case of delays, contact the respective authorities in Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, or Yanam as specified in the guidelines."}, {"question": "What is the eligibility criterion for applicants?", "answer": "Applicants must lack basic needs, be 20 years or above, and not suffer from any communicable disease."}, {"question": "Where should the application be submitted, and who are the designated authorities?", "answer": "Submit the application to the Field Officer in Puducherry, Assistant Director in Karaikal, or Welfare Officer in Mahe/Yanam."}, {"question": "What documents are required for the application process?", "answer": "Necessary documents include Aadhaar card, voter ID, address proof, ration card, and age proof."}, {"question": "What is the application process for medical treatment under the scheme?", "answer": "Medical treatment is accessible through nearby Primary Health Centres (PHC), as referred by the scheme."}, {"question": "Is there any provision for skill development in the scheme?", "answer": "Yes, beneficiaries receive training in Korai & Coir Mat Weaving, promoting skill enhancement."}, {"question": "How is the annual day significant for beneficiaries?", "answer": "The annual day serves as a platform for beneficiaries to exhibit their talents and receive prize distributions."}, {"question": "What are the sources or references available for detailed information on the scheme?", "answer": "Detailed guidelines can be found at https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/aravanaippu-illam-puducherry."}, {"question": "How can grievances be addressed related to the "Aravanaippu Illam" scheme?", "answer": "Grievances can be redressed through the portal https://pgportal.gov.in/ as specified in the sources.

scheme_data.combined_text:
The name of this welfare scheme is Aravanaippu Illam. It is also known as AILLAM. The scheme “Aravanaippu Illam" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to take care of persons who are lacking basic needs & proper care in society, and to maintain them in a safe living condition. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as All. It is specifically implemented in Puducherry. Additionally, the nodal department is Social Welfare Department, Puducherry.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Free Shelter and Food.
Free Supply of 4 Sets of Dresses and Other Daily Living Needs. 
Free Medical Treatment (Referred to Nearby PHC). 
Training in Korai & Coir Mat Weaving. 
Labour Charges of ₹ 20/Per Mat for the Work of Mat Weaving as and When Carried Out. 
₹ 5/Per Day as Daily Pocket Money.
Recreation Like Radio, TV, Library, Besides Local Trips to Places of Interest and Temples. 
Annual Tour to Places of Interest. 
Annual Day, Conducted Every Year in Order to Exhibit Their Talents and for Prize Distribution.

NOTE: Contact the authorities below in case of delay in disbursal of benefits:
Puducherry: The Director, Directorate of Social Welfare, Saradhambal Nagar, Ellaipillaichavadhy, Puducherry. 
Karaikal: The Collector, Karaikal.
Mahe/Yanam: The Regional Administrator, Mahe/Yanam.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be lacking basic needs and proper care in society.
The applicant should be 20 years or above in age.
The applicant should not be suffering from communicable disease. The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Office/ SubOffice of the Department of Social Welfare, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filledin applications.
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the authority given below Puducherry: The Deputy Director, Differently Abled Section, Directorate of Social Welfare. Karaikal: The Assistant Director, Social Welfare Department (Sub Office).Mahe / Yanam: The Welfare Officer (i\c), Social Welfare Department (Sub Office). 
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/aravanaippu-illam-puducherry Citizen's Charter: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sites/default/files/citizen-charter.pdf Contact Us: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/contact-us Sub Offices: https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sub--office-social-welfare-department Grievance Redressal: https://pgportal.gov.in/ Tags associated with the scheme include: Clothes, Disability, Food, Medical, Shelter.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Aravanaippu Illam.
It is also known as AILLAM.
The scheme “Aravanaippu Illam" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry.
The objective of this scheme is to take care of persons who are lacking basic needs & proper care in society, and to maintain them in a safe living condition.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as All.
It is specifically implemented in Puducherry.
Additionally, the nodal department is Social Welfare Department, Puducherry.
The scheme provides the following benefits: Free Shelter and Food.
Free Supply of 4 Sets of Dresses and Other Daily Living Needs.
Free Medical Treatment (Referred to Nearby PHC).
Training in Korai & Coir Mat Weaving.
Labour Charges of ₹ 20/Per Mat for the Work of Mat Weaving as and When Carried Out.
₹ 5/Per Day as Daily Pocket Money.
Recreation Like Radio, TV, Library, Besides Local Trips to Places of Interest and Temples.
Annual Tour to Places of Interest.
Annual Day, Conducted Every Year in Order to Exhibit Their Talents and for Prize Distribution.
NOTE: Contact the authorities below in case of delay in disbursal of benefits: Puducherry: The Director, Directorate of Social Welfare, Saradhambal Nagar, Ellaipillaichavadhy, Puducherry.
Karaikal: The Collector, Karaikal.
Mahe/Yanam: The Regional Administrator, Mahe/Yanam.
Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be lacking basic needs and proper care in society.
The applicant should be 20 years or above in age.
The applicant should not be suffering from communicable disease.

The application process is as follows: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Office/ SubOffice of the Department of Social Welfare, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filledin applications.

Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passportsized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (selfattest, if required).

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the authority given below Puducherry: The Deputy Director, Differently Abled Section, Directorate of Social Welfare.
Karaikal: The Assistant Director, Social Welfare Department (Sub Office).
Mahe / Yanam: The Welfare Officer (i\c), Social Welfare Department (Sub Office).
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.
Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://socwelfare.

prompts.ctu_text: The name of this welfare scheme is Aravanaippu Illam. It is also known as AILLAM.
